page.title: 16EDUCATION IN WEST NOTTINGHAM
page.content: Three{Primary}Schools have nursery facilities for pupils aged 3-5 years. Thirteen schools are{Primary, containing Infants aged 5-7 years and Juniors aged 7-11 years. One of these is designated a Special School, and one is a Roman Catholic School. Five{Secondary}Schools are present in the area, of these four are for 11-16 year olds and one is a Sixth Form College for 16-18 year olds. The{Primary}school were constructed both in the late nineteenth century and early twentieth century, whereas all the{Secondary}schools have been built in the twentieth century. There is also a{College of Further {Education}for those over 16 years though pupils aged 14-16 years do attend courses during school time.
